Communicating parameters and architecture
The Tag component communicates information architecture rather than a call to action.
It is used to classify content using keywords or labels. It is added to items like products
or posts to convey related parameters, such as categories, product features or topics. It
also functions as a link, taking the user to a listing page for all items with the same
parameter.
Click and collect Store Delivery
Used for navigation
When clicked, Tag is used to navigate to a filtered listing page to show other
items sharing the same parameter. This allows users to browse and explore products
and information without using filters, lists or search functions.

Tags vs. Badges
Tags and Badges can both be used to display information, and with the option of using
an icon. But where Badges is supposed to be a non-interactive informational
component, the Tag is an interactive component with click and hover states to be used
for example in a group of other tags to filter results and other type of data. It also has
the option of a counter. The Badge on the other hand comes in a variety of colour
options and can be placed on top of other components, such as an Avatar as a
notification badge.
